pages.title: Alabaster Brick
pages.text: TFC has a number of uses of dye, mainly it's own dyeable blocks, alabaster. To make it, you need alabaster bricks, which are crafted from the mineral gypsum.
Gypsum can be obtained by crushing Raw Limestone in a $(l:processes/quern)quern$().
This follows the regular brick recipe. Plain alabaster can also be obtained by soaking Gypsum in Limewater (Water + Flux). Using a chisel on plain alabaster will create Smooth Alabaster.

Alabaster's main attraction is in the fact that it's dyeable. Sealing it in a barrel of $(l:processes/dye)dye water$() will dye it to any of the 16 vanilla colors. This can be done to any form of the alabaster, plain, smooth, or bricks.

pages.title: Aggregate
pages.text: Aggregate is a neat intermediate to let you craft concrete powders without dyeing them first. This is so you can bulk-dye it in the barrel with liquid dyes.

pages.title: Concrete Powder
pages.text: Of course, you can also dye it the normal way.
